page.title: 12HOUSES IN BRIDGE
page.content: Houses in Bridge are mainly made of brick.Most roofs are made of Kent peg tiles the rest are made of ordinary tiles.The Post Office has Kent clapboard on its front walls and flints at the back.The newest house in Bridge was built in 1985.The first houses in Riverside Close were built in 1963.The most recent houses were built in 1983/84. Builders are clearing the land there now for some blocks of flats.Bridge Down houses were built in about 1965.Western Avenue was being built between 1960 and 1970.The oldest house that we saw in Bridge was built in 1785.It is 200 years old. At our school 72 children live in a semi-detached house or bungalow,68 children live in a detached house or bungalow,26 children live in a terraced house and one lives in a flat
